channel.generator: Webpage HTML Export plugin for Obsidian

item.title: EDI messages
item.description:
#standards #ptctools #internationaltools
tags: #standards #ptctools #internationaltools

EDI or Electronic Data Interchange is an international standard set by the UPU for Designated Operators to use in all of their IT tools to share updates and statuses.
EDI messages are categorized by versions called EMSEVT. The latest version is V3 which includes customs and transit level files


Used in all of the tolls provided by the UPU as well as the PTC to transmit data about mail dispatches from the consignment to item level
IPS
CDS
QCS
This standard is not technically a tool and is integrated into all of the other tools provided by the UPU.

item.title: EMS SMART
item.description:
#ptctools #operations #internationaltools #emstools #standards #analytics
tags: #ptctools #operations #internationaltools #emstools #standards #analytics

link: https://www.emssmart.post
EMS SMART or Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound tools is a tools used to get in-depth analysis of EMS items only ,performance using the help of EDI files transmitted by IPS and condensing the data down into KPIs
This contains in-depth calculations and ability to drill down on items in both dispatch wise and timeline wise.


It is used by the EMS Unit and the Quality control team to ensure operation of EMS items are going according to set standards
This tool is used to messure Designated Operators performance for the EMS Performance Award.

item.title: i-Care
item.description:
#ptctools #operations #customercare #internationaltools #emstools
tags: #ptctools #operations #customercare #internationaltools #emstools

link: https://icare.post/
i-Care system is used to send and recive inquiries regarding EMS items only. This system consists mainly of inquires and notifications.


As Requesting partner
Send inquiries to Destination Partner DOs to raise issues/concerns with EMS outbound as well as inbound items
As Replying partner
Send replies to Origin Partner DOs to raise issues/concerns with EMS outbound as well as inbound items
Inquiries as structured into Workflows with different level starting from Level 1 and ending at Level 3





i-Care is used to measure Designated Operators against the EMS Customer Care standards and award the best performing operators


Time to open reply
On-Time Reply
Workflow escalations

item.title: E-tukuri Local Client
item.description:
#localtool #ecommerce
tags: #localtool #ecommerce

This tool was developed for E-commerce E-tukuri local as an all in one solution for local Etukuri.
Currently this tool is utilized by Mail Operations and E-tukuri E-commerce teams.


Mail Operations Purposes
Updating the status of the item when the item is shipped

item.title: MMS Events
item.description:
#standards #localtool
tags: #standards #localtool

The MMS or Mail Management System Events refers to the events being used in MMS to keep a log/timeline of individual mail items and Mail bags for domestic dispatches.
The MMS Events are created by taking the EDI messaging standard as a reference hence a lot of simmilarities can be seen.

item.title: MMS : Mail Management System
item.description:
#operations #fad #localtool
tags: #operations #fad #localtool

link: https://mms.maldivespost.com/
MMS or Mail Management System is the local tool designed and created in house by Maldives Post to facilitate and digitalize the processing of incoming items. This tool has multiple modules, each dedicated to a specific part of the import process to increase efficiency.
Tracking elements seen in this system is a reflection of the events seen in IPS.POST for easier understanding and familiarity.
This system is the main system used by Maldives Post to currently facilitate most of the processing for import items as well as monitoring of said items


Processing of inbound mail items from Mail bag opening by Mail Operations to final delivery by counter staff. Some tasks including but not limited to:
Data Entry
Mail bag creation and processing for domestic dispatch
Process level and Item level validations at certain points to ensure correct processing of items
Item tracking and status updating via the use of MMS Events
Item log for better monitoring of item using MMS Events
Exporting of both CVS and XLS files for investigation, analysis and performance purpose
Exporting finance related documents for accounting purposes

It is crucial to note that all of the staff that is involved in any way in the Postal Operation pipeline will have some level of access to this tool

Mail Operations Department
EMS Unit
Delivery Unit
Processing Unit
Quality Control and MOD Development staff
Counter Service and Customer care
Counter staff delivering item
Counter staff collecting export
Finance and Accounting Department
Business Development and Marketing
E-commerce





Currently MMS integrates with multiple tools by using conventional XML and API connection for both Local and International tools provided by the UPU as detailed below:

Local System
VMS Vessel Management System - API
Data of MMS events will be sent and received for Domestic network items
E-Tukuri Local Client - API
EMA or posting event is automated for E-Tukuri local items from Local Client to MMS
International Systems
IPS.POST - XML
Will be used to do certain EDI updates for items currently in MMS to IPS.POST
EMF, EMG and EMH/EMI

item.title: VMS Vessel Management System
item.description:
link: {not available}
VMS Vessel Management System is used mostly within the domestic postal network to process and track Domestic Mail. The system consists of a web application and mobile application for staff to use.
The system is currently under development hence no finalized information is available.

item.title: CDS.POST : Customs Declaration System
item.description:
#operations #editool #internationaltools #customs
tags: #operations #editool #internationaltools #customs

link: https://cds.post/
CDS is used by operations staff to enter all of the required item level data elements to be transmitted to the destination DO for outbound items in the form of an ITMATT message. The details such as the content of the item, description, quantity and the HS codes will be included in this message.
The above mentioned ITMATT message follows the EDI standard of messages so that it can be read by other UPU Designated Tools and systems more easily.


Sending item level details to Destination DO
Creating, Editing and viewing ITMATT messages for outbound items
Viewing ITMATT messages for inbound items of DOs that use CDS
Exchanging of CUSTIM and CUSRES messages from Postal Operator to Customs authority
Currently instead of this we utilize ASYCUDA
Possibility for connecting CDS and ASYCUDA is there



It is crucial to note that all of the staff that is involved in the process of exporting will have some level of access to this tool

Mail Operations Department
EMS Unit
International Dispatch
Quality Control and MOD Development staff
Counter Service and Customer care
Counter staff collecting export

Currently CDS only integrates with tools by using conventional XML for International tools provided by the UPU as detailed below:

International Systems
IPS.POST - XML
QCS Quality Control System - XML

item.title: IPC Global Customer Service System
item.description:
#ptctools #operations #customercare #internationaltools
tags: #ptctools #operations #customercare #internationaltools

link: https://gcss.ipc.be/CSS/login.htm
Internet Based Inquiry System system is used to send and receive inquiries regarding all items except from EMS items. This system consists mainly of inquires and notifications.
i-Care is the more modern and refined version of IBIS or GCSS developed by the EMS Unit for EMS items


As Requesting partner
Send inquiries along with CN08 to Destination Partner DOs to raise issues/concerns with EMS outbound as well as inbound items
As Replying partner
Send replies along with CN08 to Origin Partner DOs to raise issues/concerns with EMS outbound as well as inbound items
Inquiries as structured into Workflows with different level starting from Level 1 and ending at Level 3


It is crucial to note that the seniors/managers from the respective sections will also have some level of accses to this tool

Counter Service and Customer care
Call Center Staff and Supervisor
item.guid: Operational Tools/IPC Global Customer Service System.md

item.title: QCS Quality Control System
item.description:
#ptctools #operations #internationaltools #standards
tags: #ptctools #operations #internationaltools #standards

link legacy: https://qcsmail.ptc.post
link Big Data: https://qcsmailbd.ptc.post
This system is used to measure the performance of all types of mail items using the EDI messages transmitted by IPS.
QCS it split into 2 systems as of now, with one being the legacy version of QCS and the other being the new and upgraded version or QCS Big Data. The legacy version is being phased out slowly by the PTC team at UPU.


QCS is used to see all of the performance metrics of all type of mail for a certain period or timeframe.
Drill down by Origin operator as well
Mainly used in day to day operations to check if the delivery status has been updated to IPS
QCS Big Data is used currently for mostly with metrics related to customs and EDI compliance
This is the tool from which monthly reports for the UPU EDI Compliance project can be viewed and downloaded.







It is crucial to note that the seniors/managers from the respective sections will also have some level of accses to this tool

Mail Operations Department
Processing Unit (Supervisor and HOD)
Quality Control and MOD Development staff


Mail Operations Department
Counter Service and Customer Care
item.guid: Statistics and Analytical Tools/QCS Quality Control System.md

item.title: IPS.POST
item.description:
#operations #editool #ptctools #internationaltools #fad
tags: #operations #editool #ptctools #internationaltools #fad

IPS is the universal platform used to transmit operational and financial messages to and from UPU Designated Operators in the form of EDI messages. IPS plays a very crucial role in the entire postal operations pipeline and in updating the whereabouts and the statuses of all of the items in the postal chain.




Processing of Import mail dispatches
Updating the import statuses for all inbound mail dispatches with statuses such as:
EMD, EDA and EDB
Status updating for when the item enters customs processing (Optional) such as:
EDB, EME and EDC
Updating status for items when it enters the local postal network such as:
EMF, EMG and EMH/EMI
Processing of Export mail dispatches
Receiving mail items from customers or over the counter
EMA
Processing of the item at export office of exchange
EMB and EMC
Status updating for when the item enters customs processing (Optional) such as:
EXA, EXB, EXC and EXD
Terminating the import if necessary with EXX
Transit event updating (Optional)
EMJ and EMK
Creation of verifications and damage reports for inbound and outbound items
Retrieving high level operational and financial reports
Dispatch and item level statistics for partner DOs


It is crucial to note that the seniors/managers from the respective sections will also have some level of accses to this tool

Mail Operations Department
EMS Unit (Supervisor and EMS Dedicated staff)
Delivery Unit
Processing Unit (IPS Dedicated staff)
Quality Control and MOD Development staff
Counter Service and Customer care
Counter staff delivering item
Counter staff collecting export

Currently IPS.POST integrates with multiple tools by using conventional XML rather than API connection for both Local and International tools provided by the UPU as detailed below:

Local Integrations
MMS Mail Management System : XML
Will be used to do certain EDI updates for items currently in MMS to IPS.POST
EMF, EMG and EMH/EMI
International Integrations
QCS Quality Control System
EDI data of last 6 months will be sent for statistics purposes
CDS.POST Customs Declaration System
ITMATT checking for inbound items
EMS SMART
EDI data of last 6 months will be sent for statistics purposes for EMS items only
i-Care
EDI data of last 6 months will be sent for tracking and inquiry purposes
IPC Global Customer Service System
EDI data of last 6 months will be sent for tracking and inquiry purposes
